about_the_game:
August 12th 1992

Aaron Jacobs, a student from the North West of England was on the 01:52am train home after a drink with friends. After falling asleep on his journey, we find Aaron awaking unattended at the end of the line late at night. Dazed and confused, he exits the carriage unaware of his surroundings or what is yet to come. The station is closed for maintenance, the lights are dim and Aaron is alone… For now.




Guide Aaron through the train station and beyond in an attempt to make an escape, solving puzzles and unearthing grotesque discoveries as he attempts to avoid the lurking horrors surrounding the station. With limited resources and a heart-pounding atmosphere will Aaron survive or succumb to the ever increasing threat residing right beneath our feet?



What to expect
- Tense first person exploration
- Spine-chilling environments
- Resource management
- Classic PS2 style graphics with a VHS aesthetic
- Heavy 80’s/90’s B-movie and classic horror game inspiration
- Blood, guts and gore
- Fully voice acted characters

content_descriptors.notes:
Blood and Gore
Intense Violence
Strong Language
Use of Alcohol
Tobacco Reference

name: End of the Line

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 SP1+
  • Processor: x86 32 bit
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Graphics card with DX10 (shader model 4.0) capabilities
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

short_description: A VHS and PS2 aesthetic experience with heavy influence from classic horror games and movies of the 80s and 90s. With detailed environments, gory first-person action and a claustrophobic atmosphere, witness the horrors lurking beneath the streets of Northern England
